#summary How to install this addon in Spring Roo
#labels Phase-Deploy

You can install the addon in Roo 1.1.0 like this (tested with RC1 and STS 2.5.0.RC1):

At first edit conf/config.properties of your Roo installation to add http://spring-roo-equals-roo-addon.googlecode.com/svn/maven-repository/repository.xml as OBR repository there:

{{{
felix.log.level=1
felix.auto.deploy.action=install,start
obr.repository.url=http://spring-roo-repository.springsource.org/repository.xml.zip http://spring-roo-equals-roo-addon.googlecode.com/svn/maven-repository/repository.xml
}}}

Now open a Roo shell and type:

{{{
osgi obr start --bundleSymbolicName de.saxsys.roo.equals.addon
}}}

You should see something like

{{{
Download URL 'http://spring-roo-equals-roo-addon.googlecode.com/svn/maven-repository/de/saxsys/roo/de.saxsys.roo.equals.addon/1.2.0/de.saxsys.roo.equals.addon-1.2.0.jar' failed
This resource was signed with PGP key ID '0xC3A61B10', which is not currently trusted
Use 'pgp key view' to view this key, 'pgp trust' to trust it, or 'pgp automatic trust' to trust any keys
Target resource(s):
-------------------
   Spring Roo - Addon - equals() and hashCode() (1.2.0)

Deploying...done.
}}}

Fix this by trusting the signature key with :

{{{
pgp trust --keyId 0xC3A61B10
}}}

Now try again:

{{{
osgi obr start --bundleSymbolicName de.saxsys.roo.equals.addon
}}}


Now you can verify that the plugin is active by typing:
{{{
osgi ps
}}}

You should see something like:
{{{
...
[  53] [Active     ] [    1] Spring Roo - Addon - equals() and hashCode() (1.2.0)
}}}

Next step: See [Usage how to use] the equals addon.
